intro: Diascia pentheri, commonly known as the red-flowered diascia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its vibrant red or pink tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Diascia pentheri is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
